title: IPA ref for other models
body:
Hi! Thank you for this great software. 

I was wondering if you plan to include other models or a code for building the necessary IPA reference?
I work with danio rerio and would love to use InPACT!

Thanks!

title: Input file format question
body:
Hello! Thank you for this exciting software. 

I would like to ask the author about the input files being limited to the BAM format, I am using two public datasets from GEO (GSE131179 and GSE120649) and both of them can only be fulfilled by converting from SRA format to BAM format, but both of them give me an error when I run them, prompting me to make sure that I am typing in the correct BAM or SAM format file!

Also regarding the test file you mentioned, I downloaded it and found that it is also an SRA file, do I also have to convert it to BAM to run it further?

Thanks a lot！

title: Calculate usage of IPA sites
body:
In the third step, InPACT_quantify is running with the following error, and I would like to know which file is at fault

 Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/data/miniconda3/envs/InPACT/bin/InPACT_quantify", line 103, in <module>
    ipa_usage_dic = calculate_usage(transcript_tpm_path,
  File "/home/data/miniconda3/envs/InPACT/bin/InPACT_quantify", line 48, in calculate_usage
    gene_tpm_dic[gn] = sum([transcript_tpm_dic[transcript] for transcript in transcripts])
  File "/home/data/miniconda3/envs/InPACT/bin/InPACT_quantify", line 48, in <listcomp>
    gene_tpm_dic[gn] = sum([transcript_tpm_dic[transcript] for transcript in transcripts])
KeyError: 'NM_000350.3'

Thank you very much.

title: getopt illegal option --o
body:
Hello,

I really would like to use your software on one of the datasets. Can it run on MacOS? I installed it successfully, but when I call InPACT -h
the error 'getopt illegal option --o' kept popping up. I tried to remove -o from the 'InPACT' script, but now I get another error:
error: argument --annotation_file: expected one argument 
although I'm sure that I put only one argument after -a in InPACT call.

Any suggestions?

title: How to deal with gencode gtf file
body: How to deal with gencode gtf file

title: ipa_usage.txt file
body:
Hello! Thank you for the excellent software you have developed.
I have a question regarding the output format mentioned in the README. You stated that the final output format consists of six columns: Terminal exon, IPA type, Gene, Upstream coordinate, PolyAsite, and IPA usage. Does this refer to the ipa_usage.txt file? The headers in the ipa_usage.txt file is slightly different (region, annotation, gene_id, possible_five_ss, polyA_site, Usage). Do these headers correspond to the columns mentioned in the README?
Additionally, in the ipa_usage.txt file, what does the information in the possible_five_ss column represent? Specifically, what does the number at the end of the entry (e.g., chr1:109214128:+:18) indicate? For instance, in chr1:109214128:+:18, what does the number 18 signify?

title: recommended Fasta file
body:
Hi,

I executed the following command:

"InPACT -i sample.bam -a hg38.109.20211119.ncbiRefSeq.gtf -s InPACT_polyAsites.hg38.saf -P 5"
This produced the file 1.predicted.terminal.results.txt in the output folder.

Is this the only output that I should expect?

Additionally, I attempted to run the following command, but it didn’t generate any final output:

"InPACT_transcript --predict_terminal 1.predicted.terminal.results.txt --annotated_gtf hg38.109.20211119.ncbiRefSeq.gtf --fa_path GRCh38.d1.vd1.fa --save_gtf merged.gtf"
Could the issue be related to the FASTA file? What is the correct FASTA file that I should be using?

Thanks!
